name: On the trail of the great white
author: Mark Hoel

segments.caption: Great shot of a white O.P in Lake Simcoe.
segments.paragraph: On the trail of the elusive great white O.P of Lake Simcoe. Micro-adventures blog post.

segments.caption: Lots of sampling, but no whites found :-(
segments.paragraph: On the trail of the elusive great white O.P of Lake Simcoe. Micro-adventures blog post.

segments.caption: Great day with lots of sampling. Unfortunately, no whites found :-(
segments.paragraph: The team arrived on the shores of Lake Simcoe early on a cool clear late summer day. We sampled at Minets point, Lovers creek and Hewitts creek in the Barrie area. Lovers creek turned out to be most fruitful location by far.

segments.caption: Lovers creek is full of crays. We met some nice people there as well.
Lovers creek was in a well groomed park, and therefore easy to access.
Hewitts creek is suburban, but surprisingly wild.

name: Dr. Crayfish, I presume?
author: Mark Hoel
description: Interview with Nature Conservancy of Canada

segments.caption: Juvenile white crayfish.
segments.paragraph: Interview with Nature Conservancy of Canada.

name: Credit Valley Award goes to Dr. Crayfish
author: Mark Hoel

segments.caption: Premek Hamr receives CVCA Environmental Awareness and Engagement award.
segments.paragraph: Premek Hamr won the Environmental Awareness and Engagement award from Credit Valley Conservation Authority, for the work he has been doing with the his students out in the Credit watershed. The award recognizes the hard work Dr. Hamr has put in organizing and follow through on outdoor education activities (including crayfish counts), year after year, through all kinds of weather.

segments.caption: Great day of sampling. This beauty found on Mapleview beach.
segments.paragraph:
Beautiful sunny day on Lake Simcoe and tributary streams. We sampled at Lovers creek, Hewitts creek and the end of Mapleview Road in the Barrie area. Lovers creek turned out to be most fruitful location by far.
  • End of Maple View rd. 6 F.virilis (all juveniles CPL 12-16 mm) some moulting 4 large female F. virilis. 2 of them with Rusty backs & Blue claws . One very large (photos). None measured

segments.caption: Lovers creek yielded many virilus and propincus.
segments.paragraph:
• 11 F. propinquus 2 were very light grey with blue claws: F CPL 27 & M CPL 12, 9 were various shades of grey-brown CPL F14, F16, F14,M16, M15, M15, M27, M22, M28)
  • 6 F. virilis (all juveniles CPL 12-16 mm) some moulting. Mostly toward marina side of creek. There were many there that we did not catch. Sampled from 44.372355, -79.651333 (road culvert) to 44.373310, -79.650595 (marina bend above boats)

segments.caption: Hewitts creek leads to Wilkins beach, but not many crays
segments.paragraph: Wilkins beach: 1 large F. virilis (dead), Hewittâ€™s creek: 1 C. robustus female; 1 large F. virilis (dead), 1 large virilis claw

segments.caption: 5 minutes of sampling and we found a white!
segments.paragraph: Lucky for us (and science), we were given access to hitherto un-sampled stretch of coastline on the south side of Kempenfelt Bay. Althought the conditions were wavy and cloudy (difficult to see in the water) and there did not prove to be a large population, we found a rare white propinquus!

segments.caption: Elated by their find, the team poses with an elusive white.
segments.paragraph:
Strathallan Woods (45 minute sample in choppy difficult water)
14/9/19 - F. propinquus MF1 White morph CPL 27 (genetic sample 2 legs)

segments.caption: Great views from Strathallan Woods to downtown Barrie
Working hard, but no luck at the end of Big Bay Point Road access.
segments.paragraph:
End of Big Bay pt rd. access
No crays, no trace (15 min)

End of Lockheart
1 large F. virilis claw (fresh) , poor habitat, not much cover, beach, anoxic. Interesting interaction with locals of Innisfil, Ontario. Tip was given about possible good sampling location at Lefroy.

End of Ninth Line, beach
1 predated large F. virilis, poor habitat, not much cover, beach, garbage in water, anoxic

Innisfil Beach Park
No sign of crays, bad water quality, lots of slime in water, garbage, little habitat, anoxic and expensive parking :-)

segments.caption: What a beauty! White propinquus posing for an glamour shot.
